net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.attribute

Interface AttributeWriteKeyboardFilter

    public interface AttributeWriteKeyboardFilter
extends AttributeReadKeyboardFilter
    This interface gives read and write access to the keyboard-filter attribute of an object.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setKeyboardFilter(CharFilter keyboardFilter)
      This method sets the keyboard-filter.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.attribute.AttributeReadKeyboardFilter

        getKeyboardFilter

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyboardFilter

        void setKeyboardFilter(CharFilter keyboardFilter)
        This method sets the keyboard-filter. Typically such filter is only set once (e.g. to build custom datatype fields based on generic text input widgets) and then never changed.
        ATTENTION:
        A keyboard filter is no guarantee that it is impossible for the user to enter invalid characters. E.g. if you are building a web-client some browser quirks allow to bypass the keyboard filter using copy and paste. Be sure to also validate the result in any case.
        Parameters:
        keyboardFilter - is the keyboard filter to set. An existing filter will be replaced. May be null to remove an existing filter.
